f(x) = {{f}}
For the function f(x) above, do the following.

item.p: Construct a sign chart for f, f', and f''.
Finally, use all of the data from the first two bullet points to sketch an accurate graph of y=f(x).

content.p: On your graph, label and identify asymptotes and "special points"; i.e., zeroes, critical points, local maxima/minima, points of inflection, etc.

item.p: Warning: Labels on tick marks on auto-generated sign charts are rounded to three significant digits (or are integers). Furthermore, on all auto-generated sign charts, x=0 appears as an unlabeled tickmark. This is an artifact of the automatically generating computer code, and happens whether or not x=0 is, in fact, a "special point" for that sign chart.
